snippet: Insurance companies are facing the problem of selling products in an era of near-zero interest rates, and they’re squeezing many policyholders....
abstract: Customers of life or long-term care insurance complain they are being forced to abandon policies they paid into for decades due to sky-high rate hikes and are suing insurers; companies claim negative interest rates are making them raise premiums, in some cases as much as sixfold, but policy holders say firms are looking to increase profits and have been raiding customer accounts in order to pay dividends.

byline.original: By JULIE CRESWELL and MARY WILLIAMS WALSH

lead_paragraph: Insurance companies are facing the problem of selling products in an era of near-zero interest rates, and they’re squeezing many policyholders.

headline.main: Why Some Life Insurance Premiums Are Skyrocketing
headline.print_headline: When Your Life Insurance Gets Sick
